introduction: Improve your English vocabulary and listening in just 6 minutes! Angela Merkel has often been referr

vocabulary.definition: the person in the highest position in a government or a university, especially the head of the government in some European countries
vocabulary.example: Angela Merkel served as the chancellor of Germany for 16 years.

vocabulary.definition: describing someone with traditional and strict beliefs that are difficult to change
vocabulary.example: The hardline conservatives in her party opposed many of her policies.

vocabulary.definition: an insult used to make someone feel stupid or embarrassed
vocabulary.example: His remarks were seen as a cruel put down towards the opposition leader.

vocabulary.definition: phrases or ideas that have lost their original meaning due to overuse
vocabulary.example: The speech was filled with cliches that failed to inspire the audience.

vocabulary.definition: describing a serious facial expression that shows no emotion
vocabulary.example: Despite the joke, she maintained a deadpan expression throughout the meeting.

vocabulary.definition: dignity, seriousness, or importance in manner or behavior
vocabulary.example: His speech lacked the gravitas expected from a leader in such a critical situation.
